field.label: Name
field.help: Name to identify this rule.

field.label: Description
field.help: Description for this rule.

field.label: Select conditions
field.help: Select one or more conditions to be used for this rule.

field.label: Match Mode
field.help: Apply this rule when conditions are met (IF) or unmet (UNLESS).

field.label: Logic Operator
field.help: Combine multiple conditions using AND (all must match) or OR (any must match).

field.label: Type
field.help: Choose a HAProxy action that should be used if the condition evaluates to true.

field.label: Use backend pool
field.help: HAProxy will use this backend pool if the condition evaluates to true.

field.label: Use server
field.help: HAProxy will use this server instead of other servers that are specified in the Backend Pool. The server must exist in the context where this rule is applied.

field.label: NOTE: The specified server must be present in the Backend Pool where this rule is applied.
Monitoring URI
field.help: Specifies a URI which will be intercepted to return HAProxy's health status instead of forwarding the request. When a HTTP request is received, HAProxy will return either "HTTP/1.0 200 OK" or "HTTP/1.0 503 Service unavailable", depending on the fined failure conditions.

field.label: Option pass-through
field.help: Specify a HAProxy rule/ACL that is currently not supported by the GUI.

field.label: Map file
field.help: HAProxy will extract the Host header from the HTTP request and search the map file for a match. If a match is found, the backend pool from the map file will be used.

field.label: Default backend pool
field.help: HAProxy will use this backend pool if no match is found in the map file.

field.label: Header Name
field.help: Specify the name of a request header which will be passed to the FastCGI application. Most request headers are already available to the FastCGI application, prefixed with "HTTP_". Thus, this directive is only required to pass headers that are purposefully omitted. Currently, the headers "Authorization", "Proxy-Authorization" and hop-by-hop headers are omitted.

field.label: Parameter
field.help: Set a FastCGI parameter that should be passed to the application. Its value must follow HAProxy's Custom Log format rules. With this directive, it is possible to overwrite the value of default FastCGI parameters.

field.label: Compression Direction
field.help: Whether HAProxy uses compression for HTTP responses, HTTP requests, or both. Be aware that most servers will not support request body decompression. For safekeeping only enable compression for HTTP responses.

field.label: Response Algorithm
field.help: The compression algorithm used for HTTP responses. Compression will only be used depending on the Accept-Encoding request header.

field.label: Request Algorithm
field.help: The compression algorithm used for HTTP requests. Compression will only be used depending on the Accept-Encoding request header.

field.label: Response Mime Types
field.help: HTTP responses will use compression for the specified mime types, i.e. text/css, text/html, application/javascript.
field.hint: Enter MIME types here. Finish with TAB.

field.label: Request Mime Types
field.help: HTTP requests will use compression for the specified mime types, i.e. text/css, text/html, application/javascript.
field.hint: Enter MIME types here. Finish with TAB.

field.label: Response Minimum Size
field.help: Specifies a minimum file size for HTTP response compression in bytes. By avoiding unnecessary compression work on very small files, this may reduce CPU overhead. Entering 0 disables this option.

field.label: Request Minimum Size
field.help: Specifies a minimum file size for HTTP request compression in bytes. By avoiding unnecessary compression work on very small files, this may reduce CPU overhead. Entering 0 disables this option.

field.label: Compression Offloading
field.help: When enabled, the load balancer will remove the Accept-Encoding header before forwarding a request to backend servers. This prevents the servers from performing compression, offloading that work to the load balancer. This may impact HAProxy's performance.
